column2: Introduction & Background: E-commerce executives or managers are professionals who oversee the online sales and presence of a retail company. They are responsible for developing strategies to ensure the practicality and proper design of a company's online marketing platforms. In this role, you may work to grow an e-commerce business by making improvements to customer experiences, fulfilling orders and maintaining the digital well-being of a company account.  Roles & Responsibility: E-commerce executives handles the sale of products in different online stores and shopping outlets and ensure that these platforms are user-friendly and easy to access. They evaluate the purchase decisions and specific needs of customers to make informed decisions regarding promotional strategies, pricing and product lines. E-commerce executives also review the company's technological and sales strategies to ensure that they align with overall revenue targets and organisational goals. Common duties for an e-commerce executive include: Overseeing the overall development of an organisation's retail and income-generating sites Conducting research on user-friendly features and layouts that appeal the most to customers Testing changes to platforms and monitoring the results Applying platform updates that attract and keep new customers Reviewing sales insights and using them to develop informed sales strategies Leading teams of copywriters, graphic designers and software developers in creating attractive, user-friendly and engaging e-commerce websites Making promotional offers and displaying them appropriately on the website Evaluating legal disclaimers and website content to ensure that they are compliant, error-free and on-brand Managing the smooth functioning of different online e-commerce platforms of an online retail company Ensuring that the company achieves its targeted annual revenue and within prescribed operating expenses Managing and executing promotional campaigns, providing insights on customer shopping trends, ensuring excellent customer service and timely resolution of customer complaints and feedback Working closely with demand planning, merchandising and warehouse teams to ensure the fulfilment of orders on time Analysing and providing reports on a weekly or monthly basis for each department, product or offer Reviewing customers' concerns, needs and preferences to create a smooth and seamless transactional process for buying products online Reviewing stock levels and sales data to maintain a stable supply and demand status Skills Required: E-commerce executives usually work in fast-paced environments and may have excellent time-management skills. They typically showcase great attention to detail and a proven ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously. In addition, they also possess excellent team and relationship-building skills to manage other professionals and build relationships with existing and new stakeholders. Effective e-commerce executives typically have exceptional web design and development capabilities and understand how to create and manage user-friendly websites to access easily. In addition, since they regularly review data, e-commerce executives possess strong analytical abilities to interpret and apply the data to build results-driven platforms. Other skills required to be an e-commerce executive or manager include: Creative thinking abilities Strategic thinking abilities Verbal communication skills Knowledge of e-commerce platforms Marketing skills Analytical skills Content strategy knowledge Advertising skills Team management skills Project management skills Interpersonal skills Search engine optimisation (SEO) knowledge
